page.title: 11CLUBS IN THE CLAYBROOKE AREA
page.content:
BROWNIES held in Claybrooke Primary School every Wednesday evening. GUIDES held in Ullesthorpe Village Hall every Thursday evening. CUBS AND SCOUTS are held in the Scout Hut at Ullesthorpe Camp Site. The Hut was originally built in 1935 and rebuilt in 1984. It is used by all groups in Leicestershire and is the headquarters of the 1st Claybrooke and Ullesthorpe Scout Group. ST PETER'S ADVENTURERS is a club run by the church on a Tuesday evening.
FORGETMENOT CLUB for senior citizens is held once a fortnight on a Thursday afternoon in Claybrooke Magna Village Hall.
PARENTS FUND RAISING COMMITTEE is a small group of parents who organise events to raised money for the school.
